messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] egg carton
messages.msgSnippet: ... Would be a great way to wash the kitchen floor!! Wouldn t it be Lyle-style to make the job into a cool game?  :-) ===== --Susan in VA WifetoVegman What is
messages.messageBody:
--- Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...> wrote:
>
> ***make nifty little bug-people who will zoom
> around on your kitchen
> floor ***
>


Would be a great way to wash the kitchen floor!!

Wouldn't it be Lyle-style to make the job into a cool
game? :-)






=====
--Susan in VA
WifetoVegman

What is most important and valuable about the home as a base for children's growth into the world is not that it is a better school than the schools, but that it isn't a school at all. John Holt

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] egg carton
messages.msgSnippet: ***make nifty little bug-people who will zoom around on your kitchen floor *** OH!  We did this and the dog stomped the bugs and snatched up the ice cubes and
messages.messageBody:
***make nifty little bug-people who will zoom around on your kitchen
floor ***

OH! We did this and the dog stomped the bugs and snatched up the ice
cubes and ran away with them!<G>
Pretty damn silly business.

Deb L

messages.subject: egg carton
messages.msgSnippet: What did people do before they had egg cartons? Deb L *********************** Also  - if you cut out the individual egg-cups of the styrofoam ones, you can
messages.messageBody:
What did people
do before they had egg cartons?

Deb L


***********************
Also - if you cut out the individual egg-cups of the styrofoam ones, you can decorate them with faces, put each one on top of an ice cube, and make nifty little bug-people who will zoom around on your kitchen floor (until the cube melts, then you have to get another one).

-Cat



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
